snippet: For Quiara Alegría Hudes, whose Pulitzer Prize winner, “Water by the Spoonful,” begins a run in New York this month, writing plays keeps her tethered to her family and hometown, Philadelphia.
abstract: Playwright Quiara Alegria Hudes, whose Pulitzer Prize winner Water by the Spoonful is set to open at Second Stage, uses themes from her own family history in her work.
lead_paragraph: For Quiara Alegría Hudes, whose Pulitzer Prize winner, “Water by the Spoonful,” begins a run in New York this month, writing plays keeps her tethered to her family and hometown, Philadelphia.

headline.seo: For Quiara Alegría Hudes, Plays Are Family
headline.main: A Family’s Story Spans a Trilogy, and Beyond
